response.original_title: A Day in the Life of Husker Football
response.overview: Go behind the scenes to places usually off-limits to the public and the press, with the Nebraska ETV documentary "A Day in the Life of Husker Football." On November 1, 1997, Coach Tom Osborne became the first college coach in history to win 250 games in only 25 years. He defeated Nebraska's arch rival, the Oklahoma Sooners, by the largest margin in the series history.  Nine cameras from the Nebraska ETV Network were there to capture the event in intimate detail. Exclusive scenes include team meetings, pregame and halftime locker room pep-talks, and Osborne's sideline conversations with quarterback Scott Frost. Also included are backstage glimpses of the band, cheerleaders, Husker VisionTM and hundreds of other individuals and organizations who help make Husker Football Nebraska's favorite sports spectacle.
response.title: A Day in the Life of Husker Football
